page.title: 20Changes and Life Style.
page.content: In spite of rapid changes since the war it is still possible to go along with or reject certain aspects of 'progress'. To ride a bicycle is not so infra dig as it was 10 years ago since the need for more exercise is stressed. Calling acquaintances by Christian names has become usual and seems more friendly. The Imperial and the Metric systems exist together. Some changes create the need for further vigilance. While some folk are accused of apathy, yet many react to life today like the older woman at Standford who concluded 'I always have something I am fighting for'. This area was surveyed by members of Headley Woman's Institute, Headley, Bordon, and we gratefully acknowledge help from the Bramshott and Liphook Preservation Society.
